description: Karina informs key Directorate officials about a credible cyber threat possibly targeting the BCI's infrastructure. This alerts them to initiate preliminary security checks.
The external cyberattack hits, disrupting multiple city services linked to the BCI, causing widespread confusion and highlighting systemic vulnerabilities.
An emergency team traces the cyberattack to an external entity exploiting gaps in the BCI's security. Initial findings suggest strategic motives to destabilize Stenograd.
Officials are pressured to communicate the nature of vulnerabilities in the BCI to the public without revealing sensitive details, to calm growing unrest.
Temporarily restored services suffer repeated outages, affecting essential city functions dependent on the BCI, leading to public demands for accountability.
High-level meetings focus on strategies to counteract future cyber threats and fortify the BCI's defenses, with calls for increased transparency.
The Council announces a comprehensive security overhaul of the BCI system, aimed at preventing further breaches and restoring public trust.
